lib.jog

Class window

  • java.lang.Object
    • lib.jog.window

  • public abstract class window
extends java.lang.Object

    jog.window

    Provides a layer upon LWJGL and Slick. jog.window allows a window to be created and managed.

    Author:
    IMP1

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public static void initialise(java.lang.String title,
              int width,
              int height)
        Creates a new window.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the window.
        width - the width of the window.
        height - the height of the window.

      • setSize

        public static void setSize(int width,
           int height)
        Allows for changing the size of the window.

        It does this by creating a new DisplayMode with a specified width and height, and sets the Display's DisplayMode to that new DisplayMode.

        Parameters:
        width - the new width for the window.
        height - the new height for the window.

      • width

        public static int width()
        Allows access to the width of the window.
        Returns:
        the width of the window.

      • height

        public static int height()
        Allows access to the height of the window.
        Returns:
        the height of the window.

      • isClosed

        public static boolean isClosed()
        Allows access to the closed status of the window.
        Returns:
        whether the window is closed.

      • setTitle

        public static void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Allows for changing the title of the window.
        Parameters:
        title - the new title for the window.

      • setIcon

        public static void setIcon(java.lang.String[] filepaths)
        Allows for changing the icon of the window.
        Parameters:
        filepaths - a list of filepaths of the icons. The names of the icons must end with the size in pixels, for example icon_filename16.png for the 16 by 16 icon.

      • loadIcon

        private static java.nio.ByteBuffer loadIcon(java.lang.String filename,
                           int size)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        filename - filename of the icon.
        size - the width (and height) of the icon
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer containing the icon's data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • update

        public static void update()
        Updates the window and syncs it with the specified FPS. It also updates whether the window has been closed or not.

      • dispose

        public static void dispose()
        Disposes of the resources used by the window.
